data.text:
For Immediate Release:

SK Films and BBC Studios Natural History Unit are proud to announce that “ARCTIC: OUR FROZEN PLANET” has taken home six awards at the Giant Screen Cinema Association’s just completed 2023 annual awards ceremony. The film, narrated by Academy Award®-nominated actor, Benedict Cumberbatch, has had audiences raving since it was released in IMAX/Giant Screen Theaters earlier this year.

The awards won by “ARCTIC” were:

• Best Film-Short Subject

• Best Cinematography

• Best Sound Design

• Best Original Score

• Best Film For Lifelong Learning

• Best Marketing Campaign by a Distributor

Jonathan Williams, BBC Earth Executive Producer, says,

“The Arctic spans 8 countries and is home to 4 million people. It is a diverse, fascinating environment that was wonderfully brought to life on the giant screen by the exceptional cinematography of the Arctic team at BBC Studios Natural History Unit, allowing audiences to be transported to this breath-taking environment. At a time when our polar regions are under severe threat, we are incredibly grateful for the recognition of the skill, expertise and endeavour of everyone involved in making this giant screen film”.

“It is a great honour in the Giant Screen filmmaking world to have won in six categories at the 2023 GSCA Achievement Awards. The breathtaking cinematography and never-seen-before footage of ‘ARCTIC’, deserve to be seen on the giant screen”, remarks Wendy MacKeigan, CEO SK Film.

From the filmmakers who brought you “ANTARCTICA” and “Planet Earth II”, comes “ARCTIC,”, an epic 3D adventure. For millennia this frozen realm of breath-taking beauty has been the preserve of extraordinary animals and heroic people that have thrived in some of the most forbidding conditions on Earth. But today their world is vanishing with profound consequences for the health of the entire planet.

From the extreme cold of winter to the height of the summer melt, we will follow the changing fortunes of the Arctic’s mystical wildlife and people.

The film’s release has been accompanied by an international educational and marketing outreach campaign with the goal of uniting audiences globally to inspire change and encourage the next generation to take care of this planet we all call home.

“ARCTIC” is now open in select Giant Screen and IMAX Theaters globally

BBC Earth

BBC Earth is a global portfolio brand that invites audiences everywhere to engage with the wonders of our universe. We bring amazing premium content, television and experiences to the world, across multiple platforms including branded channels, live events, digital and social media, AR/VR, theatrical releases for cinema and Giant Screen films and consumer products. We believe that celebrating and connecting with our world is more important than ever, across nature, science, space and the human race.

Along with our partners we are continually innovating to find new stories and experiences to bring insight, enlightenment and fresh perspectives to inspire us to think and feel differently about our world. From the epic to the everyday, BBC Earth brings you face to face with heart-pounding action, mind-blowing ideas and the sheer wonder of being part of this amazing planet we call home. Visit bbcearth.com for more info.

SK Films

SK Films is an award-winning content provider and a global leader in the IMAX®/Giant Screen industry. SK works across various genres and platforms, including theatrical, television and digital media, with a special emphasis on creating high impact natural history and science related content.

SK has a reputation as one of the most accomplished and respected producers and distributors supplying 3D, 2D and Dome product to IMAX and other Giant Screen theaters worldwide, with a mission to entertain and inspire audiences and immerse them in the awe and wonder of the world we live in. For more information, please visit SKFilms.ca.
